page.title: 01Landscape and Ecology
page.content:
In this area most of the land is used as pasture for sheep and cattle, with two fields set aside for crops, (barley). This area of land is flat, being on the coastal plain, with a footpath access to the foreshore. From here there are fine views across to Anglesey whilst at low tide the mud flats known as{Traeth Lavan}offers a fine feeding ground for many types of birds.
The westernmost kilometer square is within the grounds of{Penrhyn castle and consists of parkland and woodland. Part of this area is owned by the national trust along with Penrhyn castle in the adjoining block.
In square 6172 there is a small nature reserve, called the{Spinneys,}managed by the{N.Wales naturalists trust.
